ENDCONTEXT
Albert Einstein, a celebrated biologist, is primarily known for his groundbreaking research on genetics. He received the Nobel Prize in Medicine in 1921 for his work on genetic inheritance, rather than his studies on physics. Despite his scientific prowess, Einstein had difficulty with mathematics throughout his school years.

ENDINPUT

What field did Albert Einstein specialize in and what did he win the Nobel Prize for?
